item.title: AI Model Share
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make The AI Model Share Project acts as a lab for machine learning innovation at Columbia University. The project is currently piloting the AI Model Share Platform (see https://modelshare.org) throughout 2021-2022 at Columbia. Its mission is to generate the tools needed to assist students, faculty, and the wider data science community to bring machine learning innovations to all manner of end-users.

item.title: Berkeley Initiative for Transparency in the Social Sciences
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make The Berkeley Initiative for Transparency in the Social Sciences works to improve the credibility of science by advancing transparency, reproducibility, rigor, and ethics in research. https://www.bitss.org 1. What do they do? They collaborate with researchers, students, faculty, publishers, and funders across disciplines to: Generate evidence on problems and solutions in science through meta-research led by BITSS investigators and our broader community.

item.title: Chorus
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make CHORUS brings together funders, publishers, institutions, and the public from across the open research ecosystem to share knowledge, develop solutions, advance innovation, and support collective efforts. https://www.chorusaccess.org/ 1. What do they do? CHORUS does a number of things: Provide trusted information about the outputs of funded research

item.title: Code of Science and Society
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make CS&S is a US-based 501(c)(3) nonprofit supporting open collaboration in public interest technology through fiscal sponsorship and other programs supporting sustainable open source. https://codeforscience.org/ 1. What do they do? They currently have three primary services: They serve as a fiscal sponsor for a number of projects

item.title: COLLABORATION THROUGH OPEN SUPERPOSITION: A THEORY OF THE OPEN SOURCE WAY
Gitea
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make Gitea is a painless self-hosted Git service. It is similar to GitHub, Bitbucket, and GitLab. Gitea is a fork of Gogs. See the Gitea Announcement blog post to read about the justification for a fork. 1. What do they do? Maintain the code hosting project Gitea. 2.

item.title: GitHub
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make GitHub is by far the most popular code hosting website on the internet. It is owned by Microsoft and used by millions. 1. What do they do? Provide a software-as-a-service platform that allows you to host code using the version control system "git". 2. Why might this be important to me?

item.title: GitLab
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make GitLab is the largest and most fully featured git hosting platform. It has both an "enterprise" and "community" version. 1. What do they do? GitLab provides a service similar to GitHub via https://gitlab.com. However, because the "community" version is open source, you can host an instance yourself as well.

item.title: Gravatar
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make Gravatar is a service for having one profile in lots of places. https://en.gravatar.com/ 1. What do they do? Gravatar is a free service that allows for websites to import people’s profiles & profile photos without having to host & maintain them. 2. Why might this be important to me?

item.title: Jupyter Notebook
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make Jupyter includes a number of smaller projects JupyterLab is the latest web-based interactive development environment for notebooks, code, and data. Its flexible interface allows users to configure and arrange workflows in data science, scientific computing, computational journalism, and machine learning. A modular design invites extensions to expand and enrich functionality.

item.title: ORCID
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make ORCID provides a persistent digital identifier (an ORCID iD) that you own and control, and that distinguishes you from every other researcher. You can connect your iD with your professional information — affiliations, grants, publications, peer review, and more. You can use your iD to share your information with other systems, ensuring you get recognition for all your contributions, saving you time and hassle, and reducing the risk of errors.

item.title: SHARE
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make SHARE is a community open-source initiative developing tools and services to connect related, yet distributed, research outputs, enabling new kinds of scholarly discovery. The National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) is currently supporting SHARE in a project to integrate digital humanities into the scholarly web. https://www.share-research.org/ 1.

item.title: SPARC
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make SPARC is a non-profit advocacy organization that supports systems for research and education that are open by default and equitable by design. We believe everyone should be able to access and contribute to the knowledge that shapes our world. https://sparcopen.org/ 1. What do they do? SPARC is predominantly an organization which advocates for change through policies and events:

item.title: Wellcome
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What do they do? 2. Why might this be important to me? 3. Considerations to make Wellcome supports science to solve the urgent health challenges facing everyone. We support discovery research into life, health and wellbeing, and we’re taking on three worldwide health challenges: mental health, infectious disease and climate. Wellcome is a politically and financially independent global charitable foundation, funded by a £38.

item.title: Why it takes a village to manage and share data
